alert.note: Alert for Banner; Scotts Bluff; South Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong line of thunderstorms will impact portions of Scotts Bluff, western Banner, southern Sioux, southeastern Goshen and northeastern Laramie Counties through 800 PM MDT... At 730 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mitchell, or 12 miles northwest of Scottsbluff, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Scottsbluff, Gering, Mitchell, Terrytown, Morrill, Minatare, La Grange, Lyman, Huntley, Wildcat Hills State Recreation Area, Lake Minatare Campground, Stegall, Wildcat Hills Campground, Scotts Bluff National Monument, Hawk Springs Campground, Hubbard Hill, Hawk Springs Recreation Area, Harrisburg, Scottsbluff Airport and Lake Minatare. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
